result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron Preston Reeves Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence - 5TH Or 6TH Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence - 5TH or 6TH Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 18 months of initial confinement.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to sentences in cases 21CF1446 and 21CF1447.

superMiscConds.notes:
Full-time employment  minimum of 40 hours of work per week.
Must find employment within 30 days of release of extended supervision.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharges as to both counts.
Pay fine in the amount of $600.00 inclusive of all court costs except DNA surcharge as to both counts.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay the fines and DNA surcharges by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered that the fines and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended  supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  If revoked Court ordered that the fines and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be rerasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

records.addlTxt:
CORRECTION TO PLEA/SENTENCING ENTRY: 
Plea/sentencing hearing was held on 5-18-2022.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Danielle L. Shelton, Br. 40, for review. mag
Defendant's Motion for Sentence Credit and for Amended Judgment of Conviction.  (Byroon P. Reeves, Jr. - #466742, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Plea hearing proceeded.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS; CONCURRENT to Count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to sentences in cases 21CF1446 and 21CF1447; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS with 96 days credit; CONCURRENT to Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to sentences in cases 21CF1446 and 21CF1447; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 18 months of initial confinement. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharges as to both counts.
- Operating privileges suspended for a period of 2 YEARS as to both counts. 
- Ignition interlock for a period of 2 YEARS as to both counts. 
- Pay fine in the amount of $600 (inclusive of all court costs except DNA surcharge) as to both counts.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
- Mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Full-time employment (minimum of 40 hours of work per week).  Must find employment within 30 days of release on extended supervision. 

The Court ordered the defendant to pay the fines and DNA surcharges by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all waivable costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  Court ordered that the fines and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  If revoked, Court ordered that the fines and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case proceeded to plea/sentencing.

Defendant Byron Preston Reeves in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Byron Preston Reeves in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Byron Preston Reeves not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Byron Preston Reeves not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for an initial appearance. Defendant unable to be produced on Zoom at this time. Court rescheduled initial appearance. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
